intro: Lasianthus pubescens, commonly known as the hairy lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
